   Bernie Sanders
   stated on July 10, 2018 in Facebook post:
   Says Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh’s opinion that a president "may
   decline to enforce a statute .

"Brett Kavanaugh, contrary to 200 years of Supreme Court precedent,
   believes a president ‘may decline to enforce a statute … when the
   president deems the statute unconstitutional,’ " Sanders wrote in a
   Facebook post.

Sanders has a point about what Kavanaugh thinks about the president’s
   enforcement of statutes, but he’s very wrong when he suggests Kavanaugh’s
   opinion is at odds with 200 years of Supreme Court precedent.

Share the Facts
   PolitiFact Rating:

   Says Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh’s opinion that a president "may
